byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, and an employee of The New York Times from Damascus, Syria.

abstract: Russia's six-month military campaign in Syria has increased Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad's confidence along with his dependence on Russia, diminishing chances Assad will submit to peace agreement despite Russian military's sudden withdrawal.
lead_paragraph: Even though Russia has begun withdrawing from Syria, its aerial bombing campaign has bolstered President Bashar al-Assad’s confidence and ambitions.

headline.main: The Scorpion’s Tale: Did Assad Take Putin for a Ride?
headline.print_headline: Stubbornly Confident, Assad Emerges as a Survivor Adept at Juggling Allies

snippet: Even though Russia has begun withdrawing from Syria, its aerial bombing campaign has bolstered President Bashar al-Assad’s confidence and ambitions.
